 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תֶּ֫רַח‎</span> **proper name** 

**1. masculine** ==father of Abraham==: (a kind of ***ibex*** (compare Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***turdâ—u***</u></abbr>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>ZMG xxxlii (1879), 331</sup>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***capra cauca-sica***), but against this [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>ZMG xl (1886), 167</sup>; proper name, of divinity [[BDB#Jen|Jen]]<sup>ZA vi. 70</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ת‎</span> [[Gen.11.25|Gen 11:25]]; [[Gen.11.26|Gen 11:26]]; [[Gen.11.27|Gen 11:27]] (twice in verse); [[Gen.11.28|Gen 11:28]]; [[Gen.11.31|Gen 11:31]]; [[Gen.11.32|Gen 11:32]] (twice in verse); [[Josh.24.2|Josh 24:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּ֑רַת‎</span> [[Gen.11.24|Gen 11:24]]; [[1Chr.1.26|1Chr 1:26]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Θαρρα</span>, [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]<sup>L</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangGreek">Θαρα</span>. — See Selbie<sup>Hast. DB TERAH.</sup> 

**2. location** ==station on Exodus Journey== [[Num.33.27|Num 33:27]]; [[Num.33.28|Num 33:28]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Ταραθ</span>. 

<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּרְחֲנָה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רחן‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּרְמָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תרמות‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּרְמִית‎</span> see [II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רמת‎</span>]. 

 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּרֵין‎</span>] **noun masculine**, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּרְתֵּין‎</span> ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 65, Anm. 1</sup>) **feminine**, ==two== (so in Aramaic dialects generally (note Nabataean feminine <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תרתין‎</span> over against Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תרתן‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>388</sup>); see Philippi<sup>ZMG xxxii (1878), 21 ff.</sup>; **adjective** according to [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>§ 89</sup> ***b***); — 

**masculine** only construct in <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תִּרֵי עֲשַׂר‎</span> ***twelve***, after **noun masculine** plural [[Dan.4.26|Dan 4:26]]; [[Ezra.6.17|Ezra 6:17]] **feminine** after **noun feminine** plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁנִין שִׁתִּין וְת‎</span> [[Dan.6.1|Dan 6:1]] ***years sixty and two***; = ordinal, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁנַת תַּרְתֵּין‎</span> [[Dan.4.24|Dan 4:24]] ***second year***. 



 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּרֵין‎</span>], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תַּרְתֵּין‎</span> ***two***, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תנא‎</span>. above
